commit.message:
build: simplify sd-bus-provider=auto

We can just pass all of the libraries to try as an array.

build: simplify scdoc invocation

Instead of relying on sh to setup stdin/stdout, we can just ask
Meson to do that.
build: bump version to 0.7.1

screencast: report correct position/size using xdg-output

Previously the position reported was hardcoded as (0, 0). This is
incorrect; it should be the coordinates of the output being shared.
Additionally, the size reported was the buffer size, when it should
really be the logical size.

Use the xdg-output protocol (where supported) to determine the position
and size of the output and return them in the response. If it is not
supported by the compositor, omit the position/size.

verification.payload:
tree 5f03200e3c59ceb8da8a0dd28b97aa811191aac7
parent e8406fdb34f4de14bdd8bd7b8fba204d9e154539
author cptpcrd <31829097+cptpcrd@users.noreply.github.com> 1704568827 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1704568827 +0100

screencast: report correct position/size using xdg-output

Previously the position reported was hardcoded as (0, 0). This is
incorrect; it should be the coordinates of the output being shared.
Additionally, the size reported was the buffer size, when it should
really be the logical size.

Use the xdg-output protocol (where supported) to determine the position
and size of the output and return them in the response. If it is not
supported by the compositor, omit the position/size.

commit.message:
build: use / instead of join_paths()

Less verbose and more idiomatic.

build: drop unnecessary array

files() takes a list of files directly.

build: drop wayland-scanner find_program() fallback

wayland-scanner has shipped a pkg-config file since forever.
man: refer to wl_output instead of zxdg_output_manager_v1

screencast: fix source type

MONITOR=1 is the value in the bitmask, not the index. Previously this
would incorrectly report the type of the share as a window.

Fix bug in sd-bus polling

sd-bus requires that `sd_bus_get_fd`, `sd_bus_get_events`, and
`sd_bus_get_timeout` are called for every invocation of `poll`, and the
returned FD, events, and timeout used.  In particular, sd-bus may return
`events=0` and `timeout=0` if it already has dbus messages to process in
its receive queue.

xdpw currently doesn't call `sd_bus_get_events` or `sd_bus_get_timeout`
at all.  This can result in the situation where xdpw goes into a `poll`
with no timeout and a message in sd-bus' receive queue is never handled
until another dbus message arrives.  I have a case where this ignored
messages causes xdg-desktop-portal to hang.

This commit changes the polling code to match sd-bus' requirements.

Fixes #281
screencast: Add support for 24bit RGB formats

build: limit epoll-shim to timerfd

https://github.com/netbsd/src/commit/75f1bc6655cf
https://github.com/freebsd/freebsd-src/commit/af93fea71038

contrib: Add portals config example

This is an example configuration for choosing the portal implementations
which should be used [1]. Compositors and distributions are expected to ship
their modified version according to their choice of components.

[1] https://github.com/flatpak/xdg-desktop-portal/pull/955

Handle pipewire restarts

If the pipewire daemon restarted while xdpw was running then our
pipewire connection would drop and attempting to start a screencast
wouldn't work until user manually restarted xdpw.

This commit adds a listener for fatal core connection errors.  In the
handler we simply exit the process.  Hopefully systemd or similar will
restart us and then we can reconnect to pipewire.
build: bump version to 0.7.0
screencast: set type of all planes, not only first plane

screencast: send damage via PipeWire

We can export buffer damage information via PipeWire to enable clients
to redraw only the damaged parts.

screencast: Add envar to set allowed persist mode

This is an experimental feature until a ui solution is wired up.

XDPW_PERSIST_MODE=<value>
<value>:
	"permanent": allow restoring a session permanent
	"transient": allow restoring a session while a programm runs
screencast: Implement restore token

screencast: Introduce screencast_session_data

This struct contains data attached to a screencast session.
It will be used to support session restore and the metadata cursormode.
screencast: support portal version 3

screencast: Redesign chooser api to use xdpw_screencast_target

This implements a shim function to use the new api without redesigning
the chooser code yet.

screencast: Introduce xdpw_screencast_target

This struct tracks the target of a screencast and is a first step to
introduce future features region selection and different target types,
as well as restore data.

screencast: Make output functions private

We don't use them anywhere else. As such this is just a removing of the
header declarations and reordering of functions.

screencast: Use spa_pod_dynamic_builder

Modern GPUs support many modifiers which increases the size required for
the param_buffer. Instead of randomly bumping the hardcoded value we can
use spa_pod_dynamic_builder, which increases the buffer automatically.

screenshot: announce version 1

Since we don't support the permission store yet, we should only announce support for version 1

screencast: Send buffer transform information via PipeWire

PipeWire 0.3.62 got support sending the transformation as meta
information [1]. This allows clients to display the buffers from wlroots
correctly transformed.

[1] https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/pipewire/pipewire/-/merge_requests/1423

screencast: add fallback for linear modifier

Buffer with a linear modifier can be created via the explicit or via the
implicit GBM API. Wenn a linear modifier is negotiated and creation via
the explicit API fails we'll try using the implicit one.
